resources.string: Statistics are not available for custom pools
Temperatures have reached safe levels. Resumed mining.
Put device on charge to enable mining
Your mining goal or pool payout
Cannot resume mining when device is cooling
Mining paused until temperatures return to safe levels.
Scala Miner is still mining in the background.
Donations support the contributors and help pay for the project infrastructure.
Start mining on your mobile device safely and efficiently
Scala Mobile Miner provides useful information about your mining activities and prevents your device from overheating.
By using this application, you confirm your knowledge and acceptance of the Disclaimer

If you would like to help build this project, feel free to specify a donation level here.

For example, a value of 5 will make your device mine 5 minutes out of 100 to fund Scala project.

The default value is 0.
The mining goal should reflect the pool payout setting, but you can also specify a custom value for your device.\n\nThe default value is the minimum payout value of the specified mining pool.
Your device will start cooling when the CPU reaches the specified temperature.\n\nIf your device does not have a CPU temperature sensor, this option will be ignored.
Your device will start cooling when the battery reaches the specified temperature.\n\nIf your device does not have a battery temperature sensor, this option will be ignored.
Defines the temperature at which the application will resume the mining process.

This application implements two layers of protection for your device.

The first one is the As-Much-As-You-Can (AMAYC) machine learning algorithm that can predict when your device will overheat and pause the miner until the device's temperature has normalized.

The second one is a static temperature monitoring that will automatically pause the miner if your device reaches one of the maximum temperatures defined in the settings.
Turning this feature off might cause damage to your device. Do it at your own risk!
Your mining reward is based on the amount of shares that contributed to the resolution of a block.

If you would like to help build this project, you can send BTC, ETH or XLA to the project\'s wallet.\n\nDonations support the contributors and help the team pay for the project expenses. Thanks for your support!

These parameters are optional, you can leave them blank if you don't know what they represent.

To add a static difficulty or a paymentID, specify it in the 'Username parameters' field. For example, enter '+500' to configure a static difficulty of 500.

Make sure you respect the selected pool configuration. The value of this field will be appended as is to the wallet address.
An open-source cryptocurrency miner for Android devices

Running your CPU at a high intensity for a prolonged duration may result in negative effects such as: battery drainage, slow response time, overheating, and may cause permanent damage to your device.

We recommend using the Temperature Settings and a low amount of CPU Cores to prevent your device from being damaged.

By using this application, you assume full responsibility for any damage that may be caused to your device, property or self.
